Measurements of the activity of PDHC in the presence of various concentrations of TPP and with or without tested antivitamins allow to preparation Michaelis Menten and Lineweaver Burk plots ( Figure 5A,B). These plots showed that, in the presence of the natural coenzyme as well as anticoenzymes, PDHC exhibited hyperbolic kinetics. The addition of both tested anticoenzymes did not affect the V max value but increased the

of PDHC in comparison with the K m of TPP. The Lineweaver Burk model was used to calculate the K m and V max values. The obtained data showed that OTPP and DATPP are competitive inhibitors of PDHC. Knowing the type of inhibition, we could determine the inhibition constant ( K i ) values for individual anticoenzymes. As it was shown in Table 1, the K m value of TPP was about two times higher than the K i value of OTPP and about 20 times higher than the K i value of DATPP ( Table 1). Moreover, the K i value of OTPP was about 10 times higher than that of DATPP.
